text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Iraqi press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- National Assembly speaker says embargo on Iraq is tantamount to genocide.
- Turkey decides to postpone joint military games with Israel and America.
- Syria urges lifting of sanctions on Iraq.
- Education minister says his ministry has so far received no assistance from Iraq's oil-for-food deal with the United Nations.
(The above were also carried by AL-IRAQ and JUMHOURIYA)
- Editorial attacks practices by U.N. Special Commission disarming Iraq under the 1991 Gulf War ceasefire.
- Editorial attacks remarks by U.S. official in Bahrain saying that Washington will not open dialogue with Baghdad so long as Saddam remains in power.
- Economic committee decides to reduce fees on granting building licenses.
- Commentary urges Arab countries to reduce trade with America.
- Article on the economic and social implications of the next census to be carried out in Iraq by the end of the year.
- Ministry of industry and minerals manufactures 20 water purification plants.
- Editorial slams America for latest threats against Iraq.
